title: `lydemap`: an R package to map Lycorma delicatula
text: Spotted lanternfly (Lycorma delicatula, White 1841) agricultural pest native China Southeast Asia, first discovered United states 2014 Berks County, PA (REFS). Since , planthopper spread throughout Mid-Atlantic Midwest regions country, threatening wine fruit industry damaging ornamental trees. Since first discovery, many sources collected data presence/absence population density species order monitor spread impact. lydemap package contains two anonymized datasets (1 km2 10 km2 resolution) resulting effort combine, organize, aggregate available sources data. addition, package contains useful functions visualize data within R. lydemap package built intent increase accessibility key data species interest, improve reproducibility consistency modeling efforts. constantly looking expand data sources full representation SLF’s presence abundance US. wish contribute effort please contact package authors.

title: `lydemap`: an R package to map Lycorma delicatula
text: begin, let’s take look data structure: data point contains information source specific dataset origin (“survey”). data organized year (specified calendar “year” “bio_year”, running May 1st April 30th), coordinates, state. Additional columns define whether slf found (even anecdotal individual record) location (“slf_present”), whether established population found (“slf_established”), population density (“slf_density”). additional information variables included, please consult help file associated data typing ?lyde RStudio console. Metadata file can also found compressed folder lyde_data.zip contained download_data/. package function data_summary breaks data quick summary, data organized different axes. can take look data split across year States. ’s important notice data arranged yearly according biological year SLF, calendar year. allows appropriate inclusion egg masses discovered winter months laid previous calendar year’s summer/fall.

what: Maps of the Spread of SLF
title: `lydemap`: an R package to map Lycorma delicatula
text: Two functions allow user plot data: map_spread() map_yearly.

title: `lydemap`: an R package to map Lycorma delicatula
text: first function produces snapshot SLF spread United States, reference sampling effort associated surveying spread. Surveyed finding established population plotted map filled circles, color coded year first discovery. Surveys finding established population plotted grey crosses. Map SLF records function can customized show data gridded higher spatial resolution (10k2), setting option resolution “10k”. Map SLF records 10km resolution addition, user can specify area United States mapped, setting zoom variable “custom” specifying boundaries mapped area xlim_coord (longitude) ylim_coord (latitude). Map SLF records 10km resolution

title: Mapping the Spread of Lycorma delicatula
text: Spotted Lanternfly (Lycorma delicatula) invasive pest species North Eastern USA, first discovered Berks County, PA, 2014. Since first discovery, several agencies (Pennsylvania Dept. Agriculture, US Dept. Agriculture leading role) taken task monitor control SLF populations. package lydemap combines survey datasets produced different agencies United States (local, state, federal level) single aggregated anonymized dataset. includes information approximate location survey conducted, provenance data point, well biologically relevant results surveys (presence/absence Spotted Lanternfly, presence established population, estimated population density pest).
